Name: Pocket Watch: Set a Watch in 18 Cards
Description:
Pocket Watch is a free print and play 18-card micro version of Set a Watch. It is posted with permission from Rock Manor Games.

Setting: The Kingdom is in grave danger. Powerful enemies are conspiring to resurrect the vile and powerful Unhallowed that your party has just slain. Now you, the mighty adventurers of the land, must visit these summoning locations and defeat the hordes of creatures behind this evil plot. It falls to four mighty adventurers, each of whom has a unique set of skills, to band together once more to vanquish this evil before the Unhallowed consume the world in darkness.

In Pocket Watch, a cooperative game for 1-4 players, you must clear out five locations to stop the acolytes from breaking the seals holding back the evil Unhallowed. Every round you will visit a new location and pick an adventurer to rest and take camp actions. The rest of the party will take watch and battle a line of monsters trying to make their way into camp using your dice and unique character abilities. Manipulating the creature line is essential to solving each round’s combat puzzle. It is a battle to stay alive and keep the campfire burning! Use your wits and skill to fight for the light…or all will perish in the darkness.

The game ends in victory if the heroes are able to defeat every monster by the end of round 5. If all heroes are eliminated, the game ends in defeat, and darkness has prevailed.
Families: Series: Set a Watch (Rock Manor Games)

Name: Jane Austen: Zombie Killer
Description:
Regency skirmish gaming amongst the unwashed and the undead.

Jane Austen: Zombie Killer is a tabletop miniature game for one or more players and is based loosely on Seth Grahame-Smith's 'Pride and Prejudice and Zombies'.

Jane Austen: Zombie Killer is a 48-page, A5 softback rulebook which presents a Regency Period England wherein the undead are a constant threat. For 28 mm miniatures and uses D6 dice.

Players control a Hunt - a small band of leaders and commoners who hunt Zombies. They face off against slow moving Droves of Zombies.

Players must destroy zombies before all the members of their hunt are turned.

Name: Lords of Lore and Loot
Description:
Lords of Lore and Loot is a turn based game that allows each player to build their kingdom from within, explore their surroundings, and defeat the other players. Each round consists of accounting for income, building improvements in their kingdom, training combat units, and exploring the countryside with the player's heroes. The heroes can amass an army of various combat units available to each player in their kingdom according to their faction. They can explore the areas surrounding their kingdom, defeat rogue warbands guarding resources, buildings, mines, and artifacts. Experience is gained from defeating rogue warbands and another player's armies. Those guarded treasures can be used to grow the player's kingdom and armies.

The game takes place over a series of Weeks (turns) and Months (4 consecutive turns). Each week players collect gold for from their kingdom. Each month players collect resources from their mines and controlled buildings. Each player's turn consists of actions they can perform. Collect gold. Move their hero up to their movement speed. Engage with any space along their moved path. Spend gold on an improvement in their kingdom. Spend experience to level their hero up. Learn spells and abilities to aid their fighting armies. Fight rogue warbands or other players to take control of valuable spaces. Dice, from the d4 up to the d20, will be used to fight and perform abilities. Each player controls a faction with a set list of units with various combat characteristics and prompts for which dice to use.

The player that conquers all other players or the objectives set out in the chosen scenario wins the game. Conquering a player happens when a player no longer has a kingdom or a hero. They are then removed from the game. Specific scenarios will outline additional game mechanics and win conditions. There is no set number of turns or time limit for the game.

Name: The Takedown
Description:
The FBI is in pursuit of La Famiglia's leader, Vincent Milano. There's a break in the case when gunfire from a warehouse is reported. Upon arrival, law enforcement find several members of Milano's gang deceased from an intense shootout. The warehouse is filled with confusing evidence, and the FBI reaches out to you to help unravel these mysterious events. Can you take down Milano?

The Takedown contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of clues to crack and riddles to solve. Play with a group or on your own for hours of fun.

The Takedown is the second game of the Famiglia Series, the sequel to La Famiglia.

Name: Save the Cat
Description:
A game in which we help the firefighter to put out the fire in order to save the kitten that has been trapped on the roof.

Players take turns to roll a dice and do actions: move the firefighter around the board, put out fires or place fires on the board. 
If the firefighter manages to get back to the fire engine with the cat all players win. Otherwise everyone loses and the game is over.

A game that works on learning about numbers and their value, generates debate to reach agreements on the best strategy to follow and helps to manage tension.

Name: Machi Koro: Bau dir deine Verlagswelt!
Description:
Machi Koro: Bau dir deine Verlagswelt! features gameplay similar to that of Machi Koro, but instead of developing your own city, you are creating your own publishing factory. Editing, marketing, sales: Where should you start? Which projects are other players pursuing?

Machi Koro: Bau dir deine Verlagswelt! is a special edition of Machi Koro to celebrate the 200th anniversary of German publisher KOSMOS.

Name: Guess My Dress
Description:
Dress your character as creatively as you can and hide him behind the wardrobe. Now your opponent, based on deductions, must try to dress his character as you have done. If he guesses correctly, he wins!

Each player receives a game board which they place in front of them with the undressed character.
Each player receives a full set of clothes.
One game has two rounds and each round has three steps: 
1: Player 1 dresses their character
2: Player 2 uses their intuition to dress their character then asks player 1 to validate their guess using the validation counters. 
3: If player 2 has correctly guessed all three items of clothing win their round. If they have guessed any of the clothes incorrectly, they have to interpret the validation counters to deduce the correct combination. Then, player 2 repeats step 2, modifying their character’s outfit and asking for a new validation. 
If player 2 does not guess the winning combination after five attempts, they lose their round.
The number of attempts is marked on the counter panel.

When the first round has finished, the players switch roles and play a second round: player 1 becomes player 2 and vice versa.

If both players have won a round each, the winner is the person who won their round with the least number of guesses.

Name: 1814: The Norwegian War of Independence
Description:
During the Napoleonic wars, the Kingdoms of Denmark-Norway and Sweden found themselves on opposite sides, and fought several skirmishes in the border areas between the countries. This game deals with the 1814 campaign (a 1808 scenario will be provided later).

The game is a low-complexity wargame, with units representing battalions of infantry (about 350-400 men), batteries of artillery and squadrons of dragoons and cavalry (about 75-100 men). The Swedes have regular cavalry units like hussars, the Norwegians have dragoons and mounted jaegers. The Swedes enjoy better training, better supplies and more fire power, the Norwegians have advantages in mobility and skirmish ability, employing ski troops and light infantry (jaegers/sharpshooters).

The game map uses point-to-point movement and covers the border area between Norway and Sweden from Frederikshald (Halden) to Trondheim. The Swedish objective is to break the Norwegian lines and capture Christiania (Oslo), the border forts, (and perhaps Trondheim if they choose to try. The Norwegian objective is to prevent the Swedes from winning by inflicting enough casualties and delay the Swedes long enough to force negotiations to start.

The game was originally released in 2018 as a zip-lock, hex-based system with a print run of just 100. (https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/300929/norwegian-war-independence-1807-1814).
The game has been completely redesigned and is in reality a completely new game on the same topic, rather than a new version of the old game.

This is the first game in the Scandinavian Wars Trilogy from Pantero Games.

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Greyjoy Heroes 2
Description:
The Kraken’s Many Arms in the Fight

A Kraken’s many tentacles can seemingly act independently from one-another, but always for the greater good of the creature. So, too, do the various individuals within House Greyjoy. Though they sometimes are at odds with one-another, each one feels what they’re doing is best overall for the House.

The Greyjoy Heroes 2 box set for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Greyjoy players lots of new options for their forces. The set contains new unique characters, including both UAs and NCUs, with several new options for army Commanders as well. Each one has their own goals, but all are working for the greater good of House Greyjoy.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Shadow Tower Spearmen
Description:
The Shadow Tower Spearmen Protect the Wall’s Flanks From Attack

Everyone in Westeros knows of The Wall and the stalwart Night’s Watch that mans it. Slightly less well-known is what are on the flanks of the towering edifice. To the West, there’s the Shadow Tower. There, the brothers in black specialize in wielding spears, making them masters at defending against flanking maneuvers of enemy fast-attack.

The Shadow Tower Spearmen unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Night’s Watch players a new melee unit with which to protect their flanks. These troops train ceaselessly with their long spears, making them capable of inflicting severe damage on anyone foolish enough to try and charge them. They also know that their duty is to never break and run, standing unyielding against any enemy.

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Mormont Bruisers
Description:
House Mormont’s Bruisers Make a Dangerous Foe to Attack

House Mormont’s sigil is a great bear. Strong, tough, and decidedly deadly, the House’s sigil fits well with the troops that they field in war. For example, thought the unit known as the Bruisers are not highly armed or armored, no foe wants to see them on the other side of a battlefield. Their tenacity means that they don’t stop fighting until the very last one of them is cut down.

The House Mormont Bruisers Unit Box for House Stark in the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives players a rough and tumble melee unit for their forces. They eschew heavy armor and shields in exchange for raw attacking power, enough that their ferocity even shows through when defending. Their light shields are equipped with a punching spike, letting them be on the offensive even when on the defensive. Enemies must be wary of missed attacks when going after the Bruisers.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Vagrantsong: Bonus Scenario – Fool's Gold
Description:
You have to fill out a form on the publisher's website to get the promo, it's not included with every copy of the base game. Offered for free as part of a Wyrd Games Promotion in January and February 2022.

The Scenario includes a small Scenario booklet for the Scenario itself, 2 Skill cards, 3 Ritual cards for that Scenario, and a Junk card. It utilizes existing standees from the core game, but gives them a new story.

A Junk card is shuffled into the Junk deck immediately triggers the Scenario when revealed during the Camp Phase.

Name: PARKS Memories: Boxed Set
Description:
Collection box for:
PARKS Memories: Plains Walker
PARKS Memories: Mountaineer
PARKS Memories: Coast to Coast

PARKS Memories is a strategic matching game for two or more players offering simple and flexible gameplay. Parks are represented in tiles laid out in a grid across the table face down. Gameplay includes four simple steps: reveal two tiles; choose one of the revealed tiles and place it in front of you; add a new tile to the board; lock one of the tiles with the hiker token. Gameplay passes from person to person until one player or team has collected three sets of matching park tiles in front of them.

Memories captures a depth of strategy in player abilities which can be activated by finding matches of PARKS resource icons when you reveal tiles. There are a variety of ways to enjoy the game. Play a head to head game, or on teams. Expand the grid size for a bigger challenge, or simplify the game to a memory game without player abilities for younger gamers.

PARKS Memories: Plains Walkers is one of three editions of PARKS Memories, highlighting the national parks of the plains region of the United States. It features a uniques set of player abilities. Collectively all three editions showcase every US national park.

Name: Thornbright Mansion: Chapter 1
Description:
You and your party of property investors are eager to view the illustrious Thornbright Mansion that has just gone up for sale, but not everything is as it seems. Strange damages, missing documents, and cryptic notes alert you to something far more sinister inside this home.

Envelescape brings together the immersive nature of pop-up books with the puzzling mysteries of escape rooms. Explore a miniature 3D room by finding clues and solving puzzles. By utilizing intricate pop-up engineering, our rooms and clues fold down to fit into a single envelope.

Each Envelescape game (also known as a Chapter) includes a pop-up room to explore, papercraft and digital clues, and a thrilling mystery to uncover! By solving puzzles in the pop-up room you will unlock clues that will help you progress even further - just like a real escape room!

Name: Mission Catastrophe: Maximum Danger
Description: Add more danger and more fun with two additional characters (Leeloo and D4VID), 6 Asimo V robots with docking tray, 12 modules (Shields, , 19 PIP cards, 36 role cards, 16 control discs, 4 shield cubes and the Renegade Robots solo/co-op mode.

Name: The 40th Birthday Game
Description:
The 40th Birthday Game is a light-hearted trivia game that adds a healthy dollop of fun to any 40th birthday.

Created solely for this landmark occasion, the special edition game has a traditional question-and-answer format. The professionally written and absorbing questions are designed to intrigue, surprise and amuse. All the questions are on the theme of forty, making it wholly suitable for the big occasion.

Players form two teams which take turns to answer questions.
Correct answers win cards, and the first team to win 7 cards wins.

If a team answers a question correctly, they can choose to "stick" (which ends their turn) or "play on". If they play on and get the next question incorrect, they lose all cards they've won on the current turn (i.e. the penalty for not sticking). Ending your turn with a "stick" means you keep your cards, and will not be able to lose them on a future turn.

Name: Avichrom
Description:
Mother Nature has unpacked her complete colour palette in the world of birds, so that a native bird species can be found for eleven colours by name. In Avichrom, you cleverly play colourful feather cards to attract the magnificent birds.

A player may play one to two feather cards per turn. Matching feather colours are placed under each other to form rows. As an alternative to playing cards, a player may also attract birds. A bird flies into the row with the most feathers of its colour. Some of the birds have effects that can be used immediately.

When the "End of the Day" card is turned over, each player has one more turn with two actions. After that, the scoring will take place. Points are awarded for the number of feathers of the same colour in each row and for the birds attracted. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Adventure Land
Description:
Lights, Cameras, Action! 2-5 adventurous tycoons compete to build the most attractive movie park. With a jump start, you take control of a small park. Bid & choose from various attractions in different themes, employ your favourite staff members, and execute special actions to increase your control. Secret assignments contribute to the high tension in the game. When your park becomes prosperous, it attracts celebrities, which are valuable influencers to promote your park further and increase your income. But beware, other tycoons are anxiously looking at your progress and want to sabotage your plans… literally. This exciting game is one big adventure! Buckle up and go for it!!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Dungeonbowl
Description:
When Blood Bowl 3rd edition was released in 1994 Games workshop soon also made an article with new rules for Dungeonbowl. The rules was published in White Dwarf 225, September 1998. Now it was much more narrow corridors and not so much space to move around. The new rules gave a more claustrophobic feeling to the game. Dungeonbowl changed a lot with these new things.

Dungeonbowl are two fantasy football teams playing a game in a dungeon. First they have to find the ball in one of the chests. Then they have to score a touchdown in the opponents endzone to win the game.

The original game was Elves, Dwarfs & Dungeonbowl from 1989. In December 2021 there was a third version of the game in Dungeon Bowl.

—user summary

Name: Oganika: KIDS
Description:
A 36 card pack with a themed developmental thread to lead the puzzler through a variety of puzzles revealing principles and developing understanding of the Oganika tile set.

It challenges children to create animals and funny faces.

Name: Oganika: Geometria
Description: An extension pack of 36 stand alone designs which compliment the initial set of Oganika puzzles contained within the main Oganika box. Each geometric design consists of 36 tiles meaning that puzzlers must implement the whole tile set in order to solve.

Name: Oganika: Diamonds
Description:
An intense and challenging puzzling experience for use with the Oganika tile set.

36 linked cards slowly develop a deep understanding into the potential underlying geometry of a diamond shaped module. The puzzles become more and more difficult and complex, leading the puzzler slowly to towards a concluding 3D net which may or may not be possible.

Name: Winterhaven Woods: Winterhaven Wonders
Description:
Winterhaven Wonders is an expansion to Winterhaven Woods. It introduces 3 new card types:

WINTERHAVEN LEGENDS - These cards change up how each species works during the game. They add a level of variability to each game, and give you a new strategies to focus on. They are shuffled into the Woods deck and when they come up in your hand they are placed in the center of the table. You draw a card to replace it in your hand, just like wolves in 2P. They then affect all players for the rest of the game because no one player can own a Legend.

MOTHER NATURE CARDS - These cards are drafted and played into a players meadow during the plant and populate phase. They may then be used on a future round to alter play.

VARIABLE BONUSES - These bonuses randomize the end game scoring bonuses from game to game.

Name: Spire's End: Rat King Card
Description:
This is a small, non-essential way to add a touch of diversity to the deck! If you would like to change things up, swap out card 15 with the Rat King! It's a more challenging alternative of the Under-Rat.

Replaces the Under-Rat card as an enemy:
The Rat King does not use Action Cards. The Rat King's turn consist of one Action: Nip, Nibble, Chomp or Gnaw. The Rat King has no Recoup. If you defeat the Rat King. Reveal Card 16.

Name: Arlukkachase: Card Game
Description:
Get the key, win the game.

But wait! One plays as the dark power infecting players on the way. Get infected & you join the dark side. If everyone is infected, the dark team wins. This isn't squid game but it is a race to the key.

In this card game, players take turns drawing or putting a card into the deck until someone wins (find the key card).

Can you get the key before they get you!

—description from the designer

Name: Valavendur
Description:
In Valavendur you fight as a sorcerer for the rule over the magic land Valavendur.

Players play hidden karma and attack cards against each other  and bet the game currency Vita to attack their opponents.  Using Vita allows players to build towers in the kingdoms of Valavendur.

You need to be able to read and bluff your opponents and build your towers in a strategic way to get the most points in the end to win this game. Each round a player plays one karma or attack card and the game ends when all karma and attack cards have been played or when a single player has built 50 towers on the board.

Name: Inn-Fighting: Drunken Caravan Guard mini promo
Description:
This is a promotional mini that was given out in random booster sets of D&D War of the Dragon Queen as well as conventions in 2007

Drunken Caravan Guard  HP:2   +1 damage with Chair attacks
Aberrant Lurch: (Attack misses, but Drunken Caravan Guard hits his head and forgets who his allies were. Every player rolls a d20, the highest roller gains control of Drunken Caravan Guard.

The mini is just a bonus.

Name: Shiryū de la Balance promo card
Description:
A card to add to Saint-Seiya The Deckbuilding Game.

Détruire : Un Héros en jeu gagne +1 Force  et +1 Cosmos
Destroy: A Hero in play gains +1 Strength and +1 Cosmos

Vaincu : Blesser tous les Personnages utilisés pour le vaincre, puis piocher autant de cartes que de Personnages ainsi blessés

Defeated: Injure all the Characters used to defeat him, then draw as many cards as Characters thus injured

Name: Hyōga du Verseau promo card
Description:
A card to add to Saint-Seiya The Deckbuilding Game.

Détruire : Tous les Personnages gelés sont détruits.

Destroy: All frozen Characters are destroyed.

Vaincu : En commençant par le joueur actif et jusqu'à ce que le terrain soit vidé, chaque joueur acquiert une carte du terrain qu'il gèle.

Defeated: Starting with the active player and until the field is emptied, each player acquires a card from the field they freeze.

Name: Coin Set
Description:
Coin Set is a game in which you and a group of friends compete to find patterns and sets in a selection of coins, plucked at random from a bag. Each coin has a number of different characteristics. Your task is to locate sets of three coins where each of these characteristics is either all different, or all the same. And you have to do it quickly – because everyone’s competing at the same time and waiting for the opportunity to spot patterns, shout “Set!” and claim the coins for themselves.

The game is played exactly like Set, but the rules simply state the winner is the person who manages to find the most sets during the course of the game. The game ends when the bag is empty and no more sets can be found.".

It’s trickier than it might seem, because every one of every coin’s four defining characteristics needs to be considered. As a result, Coin Set is a test of your observation and thoroughness as well as how quick-witted you are. If you think you’ve found a set, but have failed to consider one of the characteristics, you’ll lose three of the coins you’ve collected so far. So you need to pay real attention to detail, thinking fast but not being too hasty. One thing is for sure: keeping a cool head will help you find order in the chaos.

Legend has it that these coins were found at the bottom of the Med by none other than Jacques Cousteau. But whatever the backstory, Coin Set is a quick and quirky brain-teaser, a fast-paced and intermittently frenetic way to test your attention to detail and your ability to see a slightly bigger, more complex picture than one coin alone can show you. Plus: it’s small enough to fit in your pocket, and encased in a robust little tin that’ll keep it safe wherever you might take it.

Name: Home Sweet Home
Description:
Win the maximum number of points by counting how many windows there are in each façade and placing the corresponding roof card on the top.

Each player starts with 6 card on hand and takes turns to play.

Players can do either of these two actions:
A: Place cards on the table
In each turn, players can place one façade card on the table:
- a door card: to start constructing a new building next to the existing ones
- a storey card: placed on top of a building already in construction
In addition to playing your façade cards, you can, at any time during your turn, place one or more roof cards on top of the buildings. To do so, the value on your roof card must equal the total number of windows on the building’s façade.

B: Swap cards with other players
player can force an exchange with another player if they have 3 grey façade cards

When there are no more cards left in the pile and no more moves possible, the game is over.â€¨Add up the values of all the roof cards that each player has placed on their buildings. The player with the most points is the winner.

Name: À la Cuisine
Description:
Make the recipes to win the maximum number of points. To make a recipe, you must have a recipe card and all the ingredient cards necessary to prepare the dish.

Each player receives 7 cards, dealt face down showing the "Kitchen Closed" side. Next, 9 cards are placed face up in the middle of the table, laid out in a square. The remaining cards are put face down in a pile.

When game starts players can swap the cards in their hand for cards that are in the middle of the table. They can do this as many times as they like, but always one by one.

When a player has a recipe card and all the necessary ingredients to make it, they shout: ‘A la cuisine!’.

When there are no more cards left in the pile the game is over. Then, the players add up the values of all the recipe cards they have completed. The player who gets the highest score wins the game.

Name: Free Man
Description:
Free Man is a 78-card tabletop game for 2 to 4 players. It is based on the 1967 television series "The Prisoner". The objective of the game is to escape from The Village and become a "Free Man".

This entails following the route detailed on one of ten "Route Cards", collecting cards along the way, placing some face up in a "Declaration Pile" (to satisfy different route requirements) while keeping others hidden and using them to gain abilities and/or thwart other players. Winning requires a combination of skill, luck, and cunning.

The game is won when the final card required for a player's route (a special card called a "Victory Card") is placed in that player's Declaration Pile.

Name: El-Alamein 1942
Description:
The first battle of El Alamein (1–27 July 1942) was a battle of the Western Desert Campaign of the Second World War, fought in Egypt between Axis forces of the Panzer Army Africa and British Eight Army. Allies managed to stop Rommel's offensive.

In the second battle of El Alamein (23 October – 11 November 1942) Allied forces begun their offensive which turned out to be the beginning of the end of the Axis forces in Africa.

This game covers the entire operation, separated in the short scenarios than can played as stand alone games or together, as longer campaign.

It is third game of the WB-95 system set up in the North Africa (after Desert Rats 1940-42 and Kasserine 1943). El-Alamein 1942 is released with optional, mounted board.
Families: Series: Wielkie Bitwy 1939-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Strategia)

Name: The Flood: Rising Waters
Description: A 5-6 player extension

Name: Sixty Seconds Tabletop Game
Description:
You have just one minute to talk on a given subject - don't let anyone else interrupt. All Wafflers are welcome!

A host is needed as a timekeeper who will also settle disputes.

The host picks a card at random and reads out the topic on the card. The first player has to speak for as long as he can (up to a maximum of one minute) on that subject. Other players listen and can challenge for: Hesitation, Deviation or Repetition.

If a player challenges correctly he can then take over the role of speaker. Whoever is speaking at the end of one minute earns two points. Whoever has most points at the end, when everyone has had an equal number of chances to be first speaker, is the overall winner.

Name: Monster on Card Game
Description: The official Monstermon Card Game is finally here! With 50 cards to battle with, you can fight your friends and local dumpster dwellers like you were back in Kindergarten! This player's set includes everything you need to dominate the playground, from the fearsome Ultralodon to the cuddly Marshmallow.

Name: French Toast: Promo Cards
Description:
16-card promo pack included for Kickstarter backers (not in the box, shipped separately).

6 "Basic" cards: Beard, Brain, Panda, Shirt, Tiger, Tooth

10 "Advanced" cards: Blood, Coffin, Goblin, Gravestone, Mummy, Museum, Ninja, Surfboard, Triangle, Vampire

Name: Mr. Fibonacci and the Great Art Commission of Pisa
Description:
Pisa 1230. A very demanding client has arrived in the quiet Berlinghiere art workshop: Mr. Fibonacci, the famous mathematician! He wants to make a gift to the Cathedral, a work worthy of being exhibited. An excellent art that is in harmony with the mathematical sciences! Mr. Fibonacci spares no expense and commissions the work to Master Berlingo and Master Bonaventura, but on the condition that the Golden Ratio are sequence of numbers are respected ...

But the two artists fail to be precise and respect the rules that their client imposes. They work day and night on their canvases, in the hope that Mr. Fibonacci will be satisfied. But every time, because of his perfidious nature, the work is discarded because it is not very precise.  A really busy challenge; but Mr. Fibonacci is a severe judge! Who will succeed in the enterprise.

Mr. Fibonacci and the Great Art Commission of Pisa is a dice drafting, roll and write game, where two artists (players) are competing to complete artwork for the fastidious client. The one catch? The artwork must be in accordance with the golden ratio. Whichever player completes their three paintings first, wins the game.

Name: The 52nd State
Description:
The game is simple; it's politics. You are a lawmaker in this brand new state. Make laws and convince the other players to pass your laws. It doesn't matter how you feel about the law, just make sure it passes.

On each player’s turn, they’ll propose a law by combining an “Issue” card and a “Law” card. The group can vote on this combination as-is, or another player (or several players) can propose an “Exception” card to be combined with these two cards.

As a group you all vote for the best combination and whether it includes an Exception, or if it’s the original two card combination on its own. When a new law is passed, the proposing player keeps their “Issue” card as a win token, and if an Exception was passed with the law, the player that played the Exception card keeps their “Exception” card as a win token as well. The “Law” card is put back to the bottom of the deck to be reused if needed.

The “Law” and “Exception” cards each count as a single point. At the end of the game, whoever has the most points wins.

Name: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Promos Box
Description: This set contains all exclusive stretch goals and daily reveals unlocked during the Marvel Zombies Kickstarter, along with a box to store everything.

Name: Ultra Werewolf 2.0 Playing Cards
Description:
A combination of a upgraded Werewolf game and Waterproof and Anti-folding Playing cards.

It's a Werewolf game with more characters in different situations and more varieties and conditions to win.

Name: Eclipse: Neue Gefahren
Description:
This mini-expansion contains several small modules that can be added to the base game individually or in combination, adding even more variety to the conquest of space.

4 new modules for Eclipse - Second Dawn for the Galaxy

     Galaktische Ereignisse ( Galactic Events )
     Aufstrebende Spezies ( Minor Species )
     Neue Ordnung ( Turn Order Variant )
     Risskanone ( Rift Cannon )


Explore black holes and galactic nebulae, negotiate with emerging species, compete in the galactic council, or experiment with reality warping weapons technology.

—description from the publisher

Name: Von Falkenstein
Description:
A dreadful knight is pursuing innocent people! They must remember the best route to safety in order to escape the knight and defend the castle. To begin, the players decide which story they would like to play: "Ambush at Münzenberg Castle" or "Revenge of the Rockenberger Robber Barons". The rules of the game remain the same. However, there is a special rule that makes the game a little more difficult for the Rockenberg story.

Like Celtic, Von Falkenstein is a game set in the German region Wetterau, where Pegasus Spiele is located. It tells stories from two nearby cities, Münzenberg and Rockenberg.

—description from the publisher

Name: Captain Sonar: Mission Vectrum
Description:
Mission Vectrum is a mini-expansion for Captain Sonar and contains three different sea cards that can be played individually or as a coherent campaign. Each sea card is included four times: two times for the radio operators and two times for the captains.

With its 3 missions, the Vectrum campaign make you dive you into a thrilling adventure. A cutting-edge military-scientific conglomerate has recruited experienced crews to test their new equipment in real conditions. Welcome to the Vectrum Campaign, which will take you from Chicago to New York to end with a climax on a secret mission! The Vectrum campaign includes 3 missions, which can be played consecutively in a “campaign” mode, or individually, with their specific rules and constraints.

Name: Wyścigi
Description: Polish game released in the mid 80's. The goal of the game is to lead a team of 4 horses through an obstacle race. Horses for successive places receive points. The player with the most points wins. The game board is built of movable elements according to the plan included in the manual. You can also create your own race tracks.

Name: Conseil de Guerre Chapitre 1: Tragédie du Choix
Description:
Make card combos to win the most Tapans at the end of the game. Make your combos thanks to your cards and the cards played by the other players. Play the right card in the right place at the right time!

Each player in turn places a card on the game board and performs its effect, he then wins Tapans and/or draws cards. The objective is to have the most Tapans at the end of the game. On the cards, special effects called Reactivation Effects allow you to make combos based on adjacent cards and can earn a large number of Tapans to whoever activates them. Thus, you have to build your strategy by bouncing on the cards of others while preventing them from bouncing on yours in order to win the maximum number of coins!

-- description from publisher

Name: Astroforce: Away Team
Description:
In Astroforce: The Away Team expansion you have so much more to deal with, not just the mission in hand, but also organising and surviving an Away Team mission too.

This expansion adds a whole new dimension to Astroforce: The Dice Game

NOTE: You need a copy of Astroforce the Dice Game to use this product

—description from publisher

Name: Netflix: Trending Now
Description:
The Judge flips over a Situation, unleasing a flurry of Netflix recommendations from the peanut gallery.

The peanut gallery chooses content and a plot twist from their hand. Which content and plot twist combo will win the Judge's heart? The player on the Judge's left is the Drama Llama, who has the ability to add additional drama to the choices. Whose plans will get disrupted by the Drama Llama at the worst possible time?

Players continue to rotate between the Judge, the Drama Llama, and the Peanut Gallery. If the Judge picks your show, you earn the Situation Card; earn five cards to be crowned Champion of the Remote and take charge of what you watch next on Netflix.

Name: All Hallows' Eve
Description:
Welcome to the world of All Hallows' Eve, a never ending rush to grab the candy before the Monsters grab you! In this game, you can take either the role of the Chaperone in charge of keeping all the Trick or Treaters safe or as one of the many Monsters inhabiting this world. Who will win? Will the Trick or Treaters gather the candy before the Monsters get them all? Grab your candy bag and head out onto the leaf-strewn streets to find out!

The Chaperone bookends rounds by moving teams of Trick or Treaters towards houses with the goal of keeping them alive and collecting all the Candy with at least one Trick or Treater staying alive by the end of the game. Everyone else plays as one of the Montsers, each with an personalized deck of attacks and abilities with the goal of gobbling up as many Trick or Treaters as possible before they collect the last piece of Candy. If the Chaperone collects all the candy they win. If the Monsters gobble up all the Trick or Treaters, the Monster with the most Trick or Treaters collected wins.

Name: Coloring In The Stained Glass
Description:
In this competitive coloring game, players are tasked with planning the color scheme for the last window in the town cathedral, and will be evaluated by the king based on set criteria. Through drafting pencils from the center of the table, players will color in their window, hoping that they will be the first to finish certain areas.

Grab some colored pencils from your drawer as well as some friends (or play by yourself), and see how well you can do in this unique take on a Roll and Write game.

On a turn player(s) will count the remaining colored pencils in the middle of the table, this is the number of adjacent spaces the player will be allowed to color in. The color they draft is the color they can use with one exception, they can't add to a color already on the window. When the last pencil is drafted place all pencils back in the center and start again.

Players get certain amounts of points for completing certain areas first and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

Name: Wine Management
Description:
Wine Management is a print-and-play, roll-and-write game in which players run competing vineyards. Using the values of two out of three rolled dice, players select an action, and a multiplier each round. The actions are:


    Plant vines
    Harvest vines to produce grapes
    Process grapes to make wines
    Complete wine orders
    Hire workers to unlock one-time bonuses
    Deliver tours of your vineyard to gain popularity



Players must balance all the possible actions to maximize their points.

Name: Builders of Blankenburg: Foundations Mini-Expansion
Description:
Description: Add another twist to your adventures in Blankenburg. Foundations includes new foundation cards that allow you to reserve space in the town, along with some special structures and a new character.

Note: Cards are printed on same stock as Fields & Flocks.

Includes:
- 6 Foundation cards

- 3 Structure cards
-- Manor
-- Guild Hall
-- Shrine

- 1 Character card
-- Reeve

- 1 Rules aid card

At this time, this exclusive mini-expansion is only available through the publisher at the Cobblestone website.

Name: Sunny Day Sardines: Wild Fish
Description:
Available in Pack Archer from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Two wild cards that can be added to your sardines deck. These two cards contain a portion of each of the four fish colors in the game. It represents a single fish of your choice when you redeem your set. The pack contains two cards that are not included in the base game.

Name: Pacific 1941-45
Description:
Pacific 1941-45 covers several land battles fought at the islands of Pacific Ocean during the World War 2. There is big variety of battles, from very small ones, through medium, to the biggest clashes.

Navy and air force are present as well, but mostly as a support forces of both sides. Games are focused on the land units. Most of the battles are fought between US and Japanese forces, but there is a battle of Shumshu, were Soviet units landed in the middle of 1945.

Game was released in B-35 system, which is company/battalon scale, but smaller units are sometimes present as well. Each day has two turns, day and night. There are special units, like snipers, combat engineers, anti tank units, mortars, anti air and so.

Some more battles were released as expansions in the publsher's magazine.

Battles in the box:
- Betio
- Green Island
- Roi Namur
- Kwajalein
- Angaur
- Peleliu
- Saipan
- Shumshu

Battles released in the magazine:
- Wakde (44 issue)
- Wake (45 issue)
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Bitwy II wojny światowej 1943-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Strategia)

Name: Attack The Dungeon!
Description:
Attack The Dungeon! is a Playing Card based RPG. To get started you need 1 Deck Of Cards and a Pair Of Dice. Separate the deck into aces, face cards, 2-6, and 7-10. Then here's where you get to choose your class from the 4 aces:
Spades = Thief
Diamonds = Mage
Hearts =  Warrier
Clubs =  Horder

The  Dungeon is split into 3 Sections : Cards  going  up to 6 are beginner & mid level dungeons. Cards 7 - 10 are the higher level dungeons.  Place a Jack and your hero on the table and roll for  damage.  The winner is the player who is alive at the end.

Name: Globe Runner
Description:
Globe Runner is a classic race around the world board game for all the family that uniquely contains questions on every country in the world.

Learn as you play by answering multiple choice questions on countries, capitals, flags, etc. to get a bonus go and encounter the hazards of crossing Antarctica, rounding the treacherous Cape Horn or getting lost in the Sahara, Amazon or Bermuda triangle!

Adjustable to the age & abilities of the players allowing people with different levels of knowledge to play together.

Quick, simple, fun and a great way to learn all about the world. First around the world wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Save Your Bacon!
Description:
Save your bacon in this cute but brutal breakfast game! Buy characters and action cards from a limited shared shop. Fight and steal from other players to get the characters you want. This fast paced game continues until a player assembles the ultimate breakfast or only one player still has the greatest breakfast food of all: bacon!

—description from the designer

Name: Tricky!: Fantasy Feud
Description:
Tricky! is a chaotic, unpredictable trick-taking game that asks you to predict it anyway. The game is compatible for 2 to 5 players. Each player plays cards to win tricks against the others over multiple rounds.

Players score points by winning tricks (or turns), correctly betting how many tricks they will win per round, and successfully executing certain abilities. The game lasts, at a minimum, long enough for each player to be dealer. For longer games, each player may be dealer multiple times. After the final round, the player with the most accumulated points is the winner.

The game is composed of 46 game cards. These cards are divided into three suits: HUMAN, DWARF, and DARK ELF, and one wildcard. Each suit is made up of fifteen different cards, each card having a distinct value, indicated by both the number in the top left and bottom right corners of the card. A card’s value is akin to its strength or power. If two cards share the same suit, the card with a higher value will beat the card with a lower value, thus winning the trick (or turn).

Each round consists of a series of 7 turns for each player, called tricks. Every trick, each player will play one card from their hand face up into the middle. One player will lead (that is, play the first card of the trick), and the others will follow in clockwise order. Based on the cards played, one player will be said to win the trick.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mars Rover Rescue
Description:
In the Mars Rover Rescue Memory Card Game, players assemble a combination of cards including a ship, base, truck, and explorer crew to be the first to find the lost rover.

It's quick and easy to play even for young children, taking around 15 minutes. It’s a stand-alone companion to the Mars Rover Rescue book.

—description from the publisher

Name: Spacematch
Description:
SpaceMatch is a fun, quick, and easy to learn solar system card game. You explore, trade, and steal cards from other players to assemble as many planet-moon sets as possible (e.g., Jupiter-Io-Europa-Ganymede-Callisto).

SpaceMatch is full of educational facts, but it's easy for kids (around 6+) to play while learning about the planets, moons, and asteroids of our solar system. Though designed with  kids in mind, the game includes enough strategy to be fun for adults - making it perfect for classrooms and family game nights.

—description from the publisher

Name: eMEMO America
Description:
EMemo is a tile matching game for 1-2 players.  Match the photos from locations around the US and learn fascinating facts at the same time. Plus Bonus CD-ROM with extra content.

In the two player versions, players compete to be the first to match a set of tiles.  The player with the most tiles at the end of the game, wins.

Name: eMEMO  München
Description:
EMemo is a tile matching game for 1-2 players.  Match the photos from locations around Munich and learn fascinating facts at the same time. Plus Bonus CD-ROM with extra content.

In the two player versions, players compete to be the first to match a set of tiles.  The player with the most tiles at the end of the game, wins.

Name: Infiltrés
Description:
Infiltrés is a party game that plays on memory and bluff. With 110 cards, 5 games are available for 1 to 12 players in 5 minute rounds.

The cards are divided into Role cards and Cargo cards. Role cards give a hidden identity that defines the player's goals according to his team. Cargo cards are the game cards that will allow him to achieve this goal.

The 5 games represent the steps of the journey of the Coal Conveyors:

Loading: 2 to 5 players
Each player place a Cargo card in one of the 9 wagons, then the players cover them until they no longer have cards in hand. The team that has the majority on top of the wagon wins.

Travel: 1 to 2 players
The convoy must pass through the 3 steps Mine, Wagon and Customs before arriving. Along the way, the Conveyor tries to fill up with a maximum of Coal, while the Traitor tries to get Werewolves into the Coal. The points are counted individually at the arrival of the convoy.

Halt: 3 to 6 players
Players exchange cards with the convoy stopped in the center. Each one tries to fill his hand or the convoy with his favorite Cargo cards, unless the Striders come to modify the balance.

Customs: 3 to 12 joueurs
Each player is responsible for a load (4 or 5 Cargo cards), each in turn takes the role of the customs officer. The customs officer must allow in a load proposed by another player. The Conveyors are trying to take 5 Coals in a row, while the Traitors win if 2 Werewolves go through customs.

Raid: 2 to 4 players 
Traitors seek Striders, while Striders search for Werewolves. All cards are present in the center, face down, the first team that indicates the position of the 3 opponents wins.

description from publisher.

Name: 1942: Carrier Duel in the Pacific
Description:
1942: Carrier Duel in the Pacific is a World War 2 Pacific Theater of Operations Operational level micro-wargame starting from Spring 1942, after the success of the first stage of the Japanese offensive.
Players are divided into Japanese (6 CV) and U.S. (5 CV) forces, commanding aircraft carriers and fighting each other to reach the control of 5 keys airfields.

First appearance: free PnP distribution at events (2014)
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Traders & Raiders
Description:
Traders & Raiders is a medieval fantasy strategy game.

On a player's turn they place a player token on an action space. Players choose a group action, meaning all players take that action, or choose a solo action, pay a resource, and act alone.

Actions include moving their character standee from one town on the map board to another, trading goods in the town where they are located, recruiting follower cards that give new abilities to the player, buy special weapon tiles that help in defeating monsters, build market tents (wooden tokens) that give more options when trading, build building cards for points and to produce additional goods, fight monsters (tokens of unknown power) and retrieve their plundered goods, and collect goods found in their current location. Strategies to win include managing resources, maximizing trades, building cards before other players, gaining the right combination of followers so each turn can produce the most resources, gold, and points.

The game ends after 8 rounds when the eighth fortnight tile (or round tile) is placed on a special fortnight board. The player with the most points wins.  Points are totaled up from building cards, follower cards, gold, monsters defeated, and certain followers' special abilities.

Name: Leo Lausemaus Klatsch-Memo
Description:
A memory variant. 54 cards (27 pairs) are placed randomly on the table, face-down. Players take turns flipping over one tile and leaving it open. When a pair shows, all players try to put their hands on the two tiles. Whoever is first on any of the tiles gets it. The player with most tiles at the end of the game is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Fallschirm
Description:
Game covers several air landing operations performed during World War II by the German airborne units (Fallschirmjager). Scale of the operations varies, from small actions (like attack on Corinth channel) to the major battles, like attack on Crete.

Among these battles are two hypothetical ones - German attack on Malta (operation Hercule) and Italian attack on Maltha (Folgore). All the rest are historical battles, along with such less known battles like landings on Kos and Leros islands.

Game uses B-35 system, which is company/battalion scale system of the high complexity. It is the oldest Polish wargames system, developed since early 90's and still getting new games. Current edition of the B-35 is 4th.
Families: Series: Bitwy II wojny światowej 1943-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Strategia)

Name: Blood Bowl: Spike! 2021 Blood Bowl Almanac
Description:
The 2021 Almanac contains:


     Spike! Journal issues 11 through 13, containing all the team rosters, Star Player rules, and assorted rules for leagues, inducements, and more!



     Star Player retrospectives on a number of famous Blood Bowl players: Barik Farblast, Fungus the Loon, Bomber Dribblesnot, and Kreek "the Verminator" Rustgouger!



     Introducing the new All-Star Spectacular, where legends of the game come together to play the most exciting and star-studded exhibition game in Blood Bowl history!



     Alternative Star Player rules - allowing your team to hire your favourites for an entire season!



     A suite of new rules for letting multiple college teams loose in the dungeons of the Old World, providing the scintillating spectacle that is multiplayer Dungeon Bowl!



     The full history of the prestigious Blood Bowl, complete with all the stats from everyone's favourite Vampire: Jim Johnson!



     Plus all the regular Spike! Journal features such as Chat with the Rat, Dirt from the Dugout, Coffin Corner, and an extended kit review with Tatzina Barbarini!


—description from the publisher

Name: Lots
Description:
After being dealt a a hand of 13, the active player turns up 1, 2 or 3 cards from the talon to form an “auction lot”. Players bid using cards from their hand, playing a number of cards equal to the lot, alternating, one card at a time–where a diamond=0, spades=1, hearts=2 and clubs=3. The winner with the largest total sum of suit-pts takes the lot cards into their hand, the loser gets the unknown consolation lot. The cards used for bidding are swept aside as discards. And so on, as  hands get gradually shaped and replaced; essentially the cards won replace the card bid. After the stock is gone, players score for the sum of the ranks of the 13 cards in their final hand (Queens, Jokers=0, Ace-10 equal rank, Jack=11, and Kings=15). Players also earn 20 pts for having five or more cards in a suit, giving an alternative path to victory.

—description from the designer

Name: Dictopia: 1984
Description: The 1984 extension is exclusive to Ulule. This extension can only be purchased in pre-order and will never be re-edited thereafter. It contains 20 additional Resistance cards (including 1 for the rules) that you can put in your basic box. These cards are more thematic and echo George Orwell's cult novel 1984.

Name: Companies
Description:
Companies is carefully designed with fun rules and tactics which allow for multiple playing styles. Inspired by strategy games like Chess and War Games, Companies has elements of exploration, resource gathering, construction, and destruction.

The rules are short and simple. However, the game can become more complex as it goes, providing a unique experience while playing. Companies is packed with dozens of cards ranging from characters to technologies to planetary events. The cards have special abilities, which, with a little luck, can turn the tide against your opponents.

—description from the designer

Name: Stranger Things Adventures Together
Description:
It is a cooperative game in which you have to try to solve mysteries and defeat monsters. Each turn you have to choose where you move your character and acquire resource or combat enemies.

—user summary


     The compelling series Stranger Things has just become an exciting cooperative card game! Will Mike, Dustin, Will and their chums manage to defeat the monsters from the Upside Down?
     Players can take on the roles of the famous characters from the series and team up to free Hawkins from the monsters of the Upside Down, revisiting scenes, places and enemies from the Netflix saga.
     Each player has their own individual talents, but everyone is united in a shared mission - to unravel the mystery surrounding Eleven and to release Hawkins from the evil presence that grips it.
     The game includes: character cards, monster cards, place cards for both the Upside Down and Hawkins, and special place cards for each season of the series.
     There are also Eleven cards for averting danger and instrument cards for special powers as well as mystery cards!


—description from the publisher

Name: Wonderland's War: Promo Card Pack
Description:
A set of five promo cards that was available as optional purchase during the Wonderland's War Pledge Manager in order to help the publisher offset the enormous increase in the freight cost of the project.

These cards include alternate art and new abilities for the following Wonderlandians: Duchess, Gryphon, March Hare, Unicorn, and White Rabbit.

Name: Beetle Island
Description:
It is 1894. A ship carrying you and other explorer-naturalists has landed on the shores of Coleopterra—a newly discovered island in the Pacific Ocean. Untouched by humans, Coleopterra is home to countless undiscovered species, including a marvelous array of strange and mesmerizing beetles.

You have been sent here in the pursuit of science. Search the island for new species of beetles, then use your powers of observation to classify the beetle specimens into groups. The explorer who draws the most meaningful connections will earn the respect of the scientific community and go down in history for their discoveries!

AIM OF THE GAME

Expedition: Beetle Island is a competitive tile-laying game of matching beetles (tiles) based on their traits. Stay focused, place tiles strategically, and score bonuses for large combinations. To win, earn the most points by the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Smart10: Tiede
Description: 50 new cards with 100 new science related questions. Requires the base game for play.

Name: Smart10: Pelaaminen
Description: 50 new cards and 100 new gaming related questions. Requires base game for play.

Name: Tiny Epic Dungeons: Potions & Perils Mini Expansion
Description:
The Potions & Perils mini expansion brings a whole new element to the game in the way of Potions and the perilous alchemists that concoct them... the Mixy Goblins!

Mixy Goblins are added directly to the goblin deck and are encountered like normal goblins. Except, they are not like normal goblins.  When you defeat a Mixy Goblin, something explodes! You'll draw a Potion Card to see what the effect is. Each Potion Card will describe a peril that occurs when you kill a Mixy Goblin and will also leave you with a handy potion for use later!

Additionally,  the mini expansion brings new Dungeon Bosses, Minions and Goblins to the game. Each presenting a unique challenge that will test even the best players!

—description from the publisher

Name: 1453 Istanbul 'un Fethi
Description: Semi-cooperative game about the Fall of Constantinople 1453. Up to 5 players may play as a Commander of the Ottoman forces. The Byzantines are represented by cards which are played by the Commanders to negate the strengths of the opposing Commanders. Byzantium must fall within 20 turns or the Ottomans will lose; the winning Commander is the Commander with the most fronts conquered when  Byzantium Falls.
Families: History: Classical Age of the Ottoman Empire

Name: The 5th Key
Description:
The 5th Key is a medieval turn-based strategy game where the goal is to obtain five or more keys and gain control on the central island. During the game you can use special cards which will give you strategic advantages and are designed to make the game fun and balanced.

After each round the control of the Castle port changes from one player to the next in clockwise order. A player can use the Explorer Spirit card to obtain the control of the port for the next 2 rounds,. The first player to obtain 5 keys and gain control on the castle port on his turn wins the game.

Battles are the only way to obtain keys. Every player starts with 3 keys and the remaining 2 keys need to be obtained from the neighbour players, the battle mechanics are based on a simple formula: dice points multiplied by the attack points plus the number of soldiers, during the match you can send a maximum of 20 soldiers for a battle and by default the number of attack points is 1, but it can be increased with the Brave Destiny Card. You can only launch an attack at your turn after collecting your village resources, If you win the battle you can claim 1 key and 5 coins if available. The loosing party will loose the number of soldiers sent to the battle unless he has hospitals to treat his soldiers.

After each battle the losing party will be allowed to draw a special card, the card needs to be displayed at any time to others, some cards are valid only once and need to be returned to the card pool, other cards are held permanently by the player. Only the defender can claim the special card and only the attacker can claim the key and the coins.

Name: Host Your Own Escape Room
Description:
Are you ready to embark on a code-cracking challenge? You and your guests have been invited to an exclusive launch party at the London art gallery Grafix. As you admire the artwork, the lights suddenly go off and you find yourself mysteriously trapped inside with no way out. One of the galleries most celebrated artists has been taken hostage and you have just 60 minutes to identify their location and rescue them before it's too late. Ideal for escape room novices, the difficulty level of this escape room game is moderate. Great for families or groups of friends looking for a fun evening of entertainment- no knowledge of London needed!

—description from the publisher

Name: Logix
Description:
A spatial board game in which each player draws his secret code, the pattern of which must be composed of colored balls on a spatial board. The winner is the one who predicts the movements of the opponents, thwarts their plans and forms the first code.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Der kleine Sprechdachs
Description:
NOTE: not to be confused with Der kleine Sprechdachs, designed by Reiner Knizia[/boardgamedesigner].

The game is about describing these titular friends instead of making up and remembering stories as in the Knizia game.

Name: Code Kakuro
Description:
Each player receives 2 score counters of one color and places them on the game board. Place the hourglass next to the game board. Choose any kakuro and place it in the magic board. The rules of the game: Each player now has 1 minute, clockwise, to place numbers on the board. The time is measured by the hourglass. Players receive points as follows:

     1 point for each correct number
     3 points for each number that completes a group


Example: If a player places 2 numbers correctly on the board and another number that completes a group, he receives 5 points for it (2 points for the 2 numbers and 3 points for the number that completed the group).

The bonus points are awarded only if the player can complete a full group within his minute (there are no bonus points for completing a group already partially placed by other players).

If a player places a number incorrectly, his turn ends immediately. In addition, the wrong number is removed from the board again. The player who notices a wrongly placed number receives the number of points for a correctly placed number. The game ends when the Kakuro is completely solved. The player with the highest score wins the game.

_________________

One year earlier in 2005 JUMBO started the mini-series of 'Japanese Cult Riddle Games' with Code Sudoku.

Name: Имаджинариум Добро
Description:
Before you is not quite a classic "Imaginarium". Each card in the "Kind" deck is the fruit of the joint creativity of a child and a professional illustrator. The children — pupils of orphanages and patients of hospices — put all their unbridled imagination into sketches, which were then worked on by the best Russian artists, trying to bring the clarity of lines and images to perfection, while retaining the idea and mood of a child’s drawing. This is a world of children's fantasy without limits and restrictions. And most importantly, these are stories that children can tell us. In the box you will find a brochure with original drawings and the names of their authors.

You can play Imaginarium Dobro even with preschoolers: the illustrations here are bright, and the images are understandable.
Finally, another feature of the game is that we created it together with the Civic Chamber of the Russian Federation and the charitable foundations "LIVE", "Ship", "House of Ronald McDonald", "Vera", "Sheredar", "Nastenka", "Creation" , "Rusfond". 100 rubles from the sale of each box of "Imaginarium Dobro" are transferred to these organizations to help children.

Want to see what cards are in the deck? You are welcome!

The updated version of the Imaginarium Dobro has a convenient plastic lodgement with storerooms for decks and a special closable compartment for chips. We've made the board removable and added scoring tips to make the game even more enjoyable. Also in the new version, numerators appeared - special tokens that help put the cards in order and make it easier to vote. Winged elephants, however, remained the same: bright, cheerful and transparent, like candy.
Families: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

Name: Great Boy The Game
Description:
Great Boy the Game is a 1-3 player narrative puzzle that gives the players a chance to work out a mysterious miracle story about Elijah from the bible.  
Players will have to:


     Explore locations 
     Find items including clues, spiritual weapons, non-playable characters, tradeable goods, and scriptures key to solving the puzzles 
     maintain their strength and confidence stats 
     make really difficult choices that alter the course of the game 
     fight spiritual battles

Name: Secret Agenda
Description:
Magic has become unbalanced, creating disharmony among the citizens of the realm, and prompting an investigation by the order of Zoological Zealots. They have ruled that casting communities in your area were illegally gerrymandered and new ley lines must be cast immediately. As an adept and member of the magic community, you have been summoned to join the sacred council recasting the lines. This is your opportunity to alter the lines to benefit your own secret agenda. Rezone the new communities to your liking, but be careful! The other communities have their secret agendas as well. You'll have to outmaneuver the rest of the sacred council to benefit your community.

The sacred council is now called to order.

This is a family friendly game for players 12 and up. Bring this game home or easily take it with you to a party or game night. These premium custom components will look great in your hand and in play.

—description from the publisher

Name: DC Deck-Building Game: Crisis Collection 1
Description:
Team up to save the DC Universe! Crisis Collection 1 brings together the first two Crisis Expansion Packs for the DC Deck-Building Game series and offers a wide variety of new cards to add to any base game. Get ready to face some of the most epic challenges in comic book history with the introduction of Crisis events and Impossible Mode Super-Villains. But this time you won’t be going it alone, thanks to cooperative gameplay that lets you team up to win… and survive!

Crisis Expansion Pack 1 and 2 reimagine the eight Super Heroes from the original DC Deck-Building Game and the eight from Heroes Unite with Crisis versions for cooperative play. In addition, the Super-Villains from those games—and some new ones—have been upgraded to Impossible Mode, making them much more difficult to defeat. There are even six new oversized Super Heroes in each expansion to go along with all the new main deck cards!

This is not a standalone product. Requires any DC Deck-Building Game base game to play.

Key Features

Includes Crisis Expansion Pack 1 and 2
Adds cooperative gameplay mode with Crisis cards that require players to work together to overcome
FOIL oversized Super Hero cards
Impossible Mode Super-Villains that add new challenges to cooperative and competitive modes
White Lantern Sinestro oversized FOIL Promo Card in every box
Red Lantern Spectre Promo Card (free with early orders, while supplies last)
 —description from the publisher

Contents Summary

2 Crisis Expansion Packs
121 Game Cards
28 Oversized Super Hero Cards (FOIL)
2 Rulebooks
1 White Lantern Sinestro Oversized Crisis Super Hero Promo Card (FOIL)

Name: おとぎあつめ (Otogiatsume)
Description:
The Black Hood has scattered all of the fairy tale characters! It's your job to gather them back together.

In this simple but engaging game, players try to complete sets of characters from famous stories, including Little Red Riding Hood, Alice in Wonderland, Urashima and the Kingdom Beneath the Sea, and Journey to the West.

Each player begins with a hand of four cards, and there is a face-down deck with two face-up cards on each side. On their turn, a player must discard a card to one of the face-up piles. They then draw from either the face-down deck or the other face-up pile.

The goal is to complete one of the four-character story sets or two of the two-character story sets. The first to complete such a set wins. To add to the fun, each character is only on one card but may appear in multiple stories, and the Black Hood card acts as a wild. Advanced rules, where you must play until winning twice in a row, are also available.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Little Red Riding Hood
Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Snow White
Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: The Tortoise and the Hare
Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Three Little Pigs

Name: Peco Peco
Description:
The players seek to assemble different Foods in order to present the best buffet.

The game is played in several round, continuing until no one has played a card after everyone at the table has had a turn.
Each player, during their turn can play 1 Animal card from their hand if it beats the one at the top of the discard pile.
There are 3 types of cards:
- The Cat must be played over/beats the Mouse
- The Mouse must be played over/beats the Elephant
- The Elephant must be played over/beats the Cat

The player is also allowed to pass even though a playable card is in the hand, it is called bluffing.

At the beginning of the next turn, the player can accuse the previous player to have bluffed.
If the accuser is right, the accuser take 1 Animal card from the bluffer's hand, if the accuser is wrong, the accused player can take a card in the accuser's hand.

The last player to have played 1 Animal card wins that round and the prize (1 Food card).

The game proceeds until one player gather 1 Food card of each type: Maki, Sushi and Onigiri.

Name: DC Deck-Building Game: Crossover Collection 1
Description:
Upgrade your DC Deck-Building Game Experience! Crossover Collection 1 brings together three classic Crossover Packs in one package. Each expansion lets you play as new Super Heroes or Super-Villains, adds new game cards, and introduces innovative mechanics to any base game in the DC Deck-Building Game series.

Key Features
Three Crossover Pack expansions: The Rogues, Birds of Prey, and New Gods
New game mechanics: Teamwork, card rotation, Homeworlds
Black Racer Promo Card in every box
Limited edition Reverse-Flash Promo Card free with early orders.
Foil oversized Character cards

In Crossover Pack 5: The Rogues, you become a Super-Villain who always has some help within reach, thanks to “Teamwork.” This keyword found on many of the cards allows you to play the top card of another player’s deck. The code “honor among thieves” usually applies here, as the player who assists you gets a piece of the action.

In Crossover Pack 6: Birds of Prey, you can play as the preeminent all-female covert ops team founded by Black Canary and Oracle. A brand-new innovation in this expansion is card rotation. Many effects on the cards, including the Super Heroes, allow players to rotate their cards and earn bonuses.

In Crossover Pack 7: The New Gods, you can play as Super Heroes living on New Genesis or Super-Villains residing on Apokolips. There are two stacks of HOMEWORLD cards, each with a special ability that all players can take advantage of. If you are Darkseid, you seek to conquer New Genesis … but so do your fellow Super-Villain players. The Super Heroes, conversely, compete to conquer Apokolips.

This is not a standalone product. Requires any DC Deck-Building Game base game to play.

Name: DC Deck-Building Game: White Lantern Sinestro and Red Lantern Spectre Promo Cards
Description:
Created for the release of DC Deck-Building Game: Crisis Collection 1, the White Lantern Sinestro oversized FOIL Promo Card and Red Lantern Spectre Promo Card add new gameplay possibilities to any game in the series.

White Lantern Sinestro
Crisis Super Hero
Each time you destroy a card, you may discard 2 cards. If you do, gain the destroyed card and put it into your hand.

Red Lantern Spectre
Villain (Impossible Mode Super-Villain)

+ 3 Power

Each foe gains a Weakness for each Attack card in their discard pile.
Stack Ongoing: When an Attack card enters or leaves the Line-Up, resolve its Attack against each player.
First Appearance — Attack: Each player puts an Attack card from the destroyed pile into the Line-Up.
6 VP
Cost 13

Name: DC Deck-Building Game: Black Racer and Reverse-Flash Promo Cards
Description:
Created for the release of DC Deck-Building Game: Crossover Collection 1, the Black Racer and Reverse-Flash Promo Cards add new gameplay possibilities to any game in the series.

Black Racer
Villain
[b]Apokolips Protector: 4[/b]
If you have [b]9+ Power[/b], destroy any number of cards in the Line-Up. Refill the Line-up.
2 VP
Cost 7

Reverse-Flash
Villain (Super-Villain)
[b]+3 Power[/b] and draw a card.
Each time you gain 2 or more VP this turn, draw a card.
[b]First Appearance — Attack[/b]: Each player discards all cards with VP value 1 or greater. Draw a card for each card discarded this way.
6 VP
Cost 12

Name: Kings of War: Clash of Kings – 2022 Edition
Description:
This supplement for Kings of War introduces two whole new armies to the game, the Halflings and the Riftforged Orcs.

As well as all the background and lists for these two new factions. there's a narrative campaign with new scenarios and the annual Clash of Kings game update.  This supplement has big changes to magic, new items, and spells, and new and changed units for every army.  Formations are back too for every list, and there is a slew of new heroes.

Name: Last Full Measure: The Maryland Campaign
Description:
Lee's 1862 invasion of Maryland from South Mountain and Harper's Ferry to the Battle of Antietam at 300 yards per hex, 100 men per strength point, regiments, artillery batteries, in 944 counters and a 43 x 55 inch map.
The files for Last Full Measure titles are free to download, print, and play.

Name: M.A.D. Bots
Description:
Inspired by modern, real world, robot combat, M.A.D.Bots takes the idea of pitting two custom built robots against one another in a contest of speed, force, and luck.

Using cards, players choose their drive system, weapon system, and level of defense to create their robot.  Then they roll to enhance the natural levels of those parts.  Taking as many turns as it takes, each turn a combination of the strategy of your build and the luck of the dice to move faster, attack harder, and destroy your opponent.

Name: Kitten Box
Description:
Roll and organize the scattered boxes faster than anyone else so the kitten can go in, then you'll earn the title as "the best personal cat servant!"

Kitten Box is a puzzle game for 1 to 6 player which requires players their spatial perception and sequential thinking to solve the problem.

First, you open a challenge card and place two boxes and the kitten figure on their starting position. Then, everyone rushes to find the way to organize two boxes in one (by rolling the smaller one into the bigger one) and then bring them in front of the kitten. (So, the kitten may jump in and make itself cozy!)

Players CANNOT physically touch the boxes when they do this, but they may use their personal drawing board to mark their plan how they will roll the boxes.

Once it's done, players will take turn proving their solution from who claimed the shortest way.  Whoever gets it right, takes the challenge card. When a player collects certain number of cards depend on the number of player, wins the game.
Families: Components: Dry Erase Markers / Dry Erase Surfaces

Name: Defending Ruins: Pavlov's House
Description:
Get the game at wargame vault:https://www.wargamevault.com/product/386322/Defending-Ruins-Pavlovs-house?fbclid=IwAR2TX18VDh3WD2Txc1Zn8ZwAexKyW3EfM0YUggDlRrqdjCJFSuowYVDZKAY

This is a single player Roll And Write mechanics game with a minimum duration of 20 minutes.

The German invasion of Stalingrad absorbed a great deal of military and human material for the defense of this city stationed on the Volga, defense is vital and it will be fought in any corner. Pavlov´s house or the lighthouse is an important point on the of January 9 square, if you miss this point you will probably miss a large part of the city. Defend her to the death.

Name: Impel City
Description:
Find out about the possibilities of the Impel Group. Meet ImpelCity, a city where the services and products of the Impel Group help to live comfortably and safely every day. It is a city that is not on the map, but you can easily find it in Impel's comprehensive business offer.

On their turn, a player picks a card then he/she choose section for resources and performs certain actions.

The game ends when the last card is chosen. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Shadowverse Evolve
Description:
The offline version of famous Japanese online collectible card game Shadowverse.
Each player plays a hero who has 20 life points and use minions to fight the opponent. The minions can evolve and attack the opponent, the player who makes the opponent's life point to 0 will win the game.
